Reviews.Title: “Hotel should be closed down and demolished!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Liz H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this hotel through trivago and I thought I was getting a bargain. NOT!!!! I made the mistake of not reading these reviews and looking at the pictures on the hotel website. It's NOTHING like the pictures on the website. The room we were allocated had a broken tv and a wardrobe that was held together with the side of the chest of drawers. The bathroom window was not frosted so everyone from the street could see us on the toilet. The walls and floors were filthy, the lights had no light bulbs, mirrors were broken, place held together with mastik, none of the crockery of cutlery matched and to top it all we found a used hyperdermic needle next to the television. I asked for a different room and that was just as bad. We got no sleep because of the noise of the traffic and there was no hot water for a shower. They said we would be given a full english breakfast between 8 - 10am and we was offered toast and jam or toast, egg and beans. We chose the latter and no word of a lie there was no more than 2 teaspoonsful of beans. The whole place is a joke. It should be given a government health warning, closed down and demolished!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting !!!”
Reviews.Author: Steven M
Reviews.Content: All the other reviews have already said it, I just wish I had read them before I booked, the place was filthy, the staff rude and arrogant, next time I have to stay in London I would prefer to sleep on the street rather than stay here..... This place should be closed down.............

Reviews.Title: “the worst experence I`ve ever had”
Reviews.Author: Ruta K
Reviews.Content: it`s not a hotel, it`s - a hole. I mean everything: rooms, staff, service.

Reviews.Title: “Appalling”
Reviews.Author: Peregrinati
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a sort of shed at the back, hole in the wall filled with expanding foam, old fridge as a bed side table. OK breakfast was included but do the staff need to brush their hair in the kitchen area. The view over the commercial back yard wasn't great

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheeful”
Reviews.Author: Linda100756 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: Clean, pleasant and helpful staff. No luxuries Breakfast thrown in, basic but substantial Noisy at night, fire alarms went off first night

Reviews.Title: “STAYED IN 150+ HOTELS....WORST EXPERIENCE EVER BY FAR”
Reviews.Author: ajaxflow
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner arrived at the hotel excited about our first stay in London. Immediately we saw a shed outside it with a hand written sign saying RECEPTION on the glass window. We walked in greeting the receptionist and were met with a grunt. Handing our booking sheets he stared at them for 2 minutes and I asked if there was a problem. He started shaking his head saying 'no no no'. I asked if we could check into our room. He said no as our name wasnt on the system ! He said there was no evidence of us ever booking a room with them for that night. The man was Pakistani and his English was very broken which was convient. We were late checking in but this astonished us as we rang twice in the week to let them know what time we'd be getting there. Not once, twice! He said there was no evidence of the phone call and I could be making it up. Despite him sounding like the same person I spoke to on the phone. A refund was not forthcoming saying they do not deal with refunds at the reception desk and it is all done via 3rd partys. He said they had no spare rooms and could not help any further. He was unable to comprehend the point that we had actually already paid for our room. After 10 minutes of discussion me and my partner left and we spent the night on the streets of London using our suitcases as matresses and coats as blankets. As well as this experience the hotel looked totally horrible from the outside. The 'reception' had me in disbelief. The only postiive thing I can think of is the name which does sound grand. I got deceived by this when booking. I am pleased for people who had positive experiences here. It sounds like you were in the minority....that is actually getting into the room you have already paid for and booked. Well done, as I said you are in the minority. The best way to get a room here is pay in cash on the day. No cards, cash. I have been informed by a local who used to work there, that they purposely double book third party bookings which have already paid as most people do not go to the effort of following up getting their money back. It is a scam of which the wheels will hopefully fall off. As we walked off we saw his friend/colleague had appeared in the 'reception' with both their feet up on the table laughing at us. Please listen to this review and be very very hesistant about booking a hotel with them unless you have money to burn for nothing.

Reviews.Title: “Dont believe all you hear about this hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: chubby74 Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I very nearly cancelled this booking, due to the negative feedback that had been written prior to our arrival. We decided to go with it, due to the significant savings we would make due to the remaining Hotels within a 10 mile radius of London City charging, on average: £135.00 per night! We got our room at the Shelton for £45.00 Yes, its not the; Ramada, Raddison or a Hilton, yes our; toilet seat was broken (this was replaced immediately), as was the shower, the room was small and in need of some repairs here and there. Yes, the view was of an abandoned workshop, the TV was tiny as was the cupboard/storage..!! But, its a 1min walk to Harringay Station, the bed was comfy, staff friendly and breakfast was included (the chain of Travelodges around London averaged £89.00 on that particular night - not inc Breakfast!!)... A message to others; Dont stay here if you expect a Plasma Tv, Jacuzzi Bath, Concierge service or other 4/5 star treatments.......but also dont criticise if you have chosen to stay here because all you want to pay is £40 for a room in London - for 2 people - including Breakfast.......

Reviews.Title: “Never stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: LaurenGreatrex
Reviews.Content: Terrible service isn't an understatement. Booked this hotel for may bank holiday so my boyfriend, 2 friends and myself could attend a concert and stop in London overnight as were originally from Birmingham. Received confirmation that we had two double rooms however on arrival they had lost one of our booking and refused to do anything about it! Following an argument where they refused a cash refund, we were left with no where to stay and in an area we knew nothing about. They were extremely unhelpful, couldn't have done less and plain rude. I would never wish to see this hell hole again! The parking is at the front of the hotel, 3 spaces and the middle car would be blocked in. The outside is grubby and needs to have a fight with a pot of paint and the location is dangerous and built up of back roads. It's cheap for a reason.

Reviews.Title: “Ive stayed in hotels in 3rd world countries that were better than this hole”
Reviews.Author: WesandLena
Reviews.Content: This place was disgraceful. It should have been called “The London S-HELL-TON cess pit” I literally have never stayed in a worse place in my entire life. After standing in silence, despite asking questions of the receptionist, and having to search for my own name on the list of guests we were finally given the key to room number 12. The shower had mildew all over walls which were still wet. The shower had to be hand held as the holder on the wall was broken. In addition, I had to turn the shower off during my shower to allow the standing water to drain away. There was a large hole in the ceiling in the bathroom with plaster falling out and a significant draft coming from it. I am unsure what the scratching sounds were above it but I’m sure I can hazard a guess. The sink was dirty and also had standing water. My partner and I were given 3 hand towels for the room. There were two cups complete with tea bags, sugar and milk but the room had no kettle so were rendered useless. The single pane window did not close properly and so it was cold and you could hear everything outside. The TV did not work as the poorly hand modified coax cable did not fit. When I questioned the receptionist and asked for a portable aerial or if they could fix it, I was greeted with the response “no, we are refurbishing, you can see that”. I can categorically deny there was any sign of anything that looked refurbished. The set of drawers contained an empty packet of cigarettes and several screws. The light in the main room on the wall had no bulb. The plug sockets on the wall were coming away from it and did not appear safe. After a poor nights sleep we ventured down to breakfast to a room that stank of old grease and cooking oil. We were greeted by a lady with the word “tea or coffee”, and then she wandered off. As you can imagine, we were eagerly awaiting our breakfast and didn’t know what to pick when we were told “breakfast today consists of eggs, toast, butter and jam”…… I will ensure in future I stay a million miles away from this utter cesspit of a building (I cannot bring myself to say hotel as I feel I will be going against all my beliefs). Three words “STAY WELL AWAY”.

Reviews.Title: “Don't book this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: JohnH20Jan
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel for one night to go to a football match. We were going to be arriving late on the Saturday, so contacted the hotel the night before to inform them of the late arrival and not to sell the room to anyone else. Arrived at the hotel at about 21.30 only to be told that there was no booking for us. we were a party of 8 and had booked and paid for 3 rooms through Booking.com. We showed the receptionist, in what I can only describe as a glass box for a reception, our reservation and receipt for payment but to no avail. We then had to wander about London at 22.00 on a Saturday night looking for alternative accommodation. ABSOLUTELY DISGRACEFUL.

Reviews.Title: “doss house dont go there”
Reviews.Author: beryl33
Reviews.Content: This is possibly the worst place i have ever had the misfortune to stay in ,my husband and i took our four grandchildren to London for three days and had to stay in this dump it is totally un acceptable,had we been on our own we would not have stayed there the breakfast was disgusting .

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for a reason”
Reviews.Author: Boabe Posted by an OctopusTravel traveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel was ok I suppose. I went with a friend to stay there for the Scotland v Brazil game. The rooms were not in a great state with holes in the walls and a cockroach in one of the rooms. Beds were ok and my shower was ok but my friends was pretty grim looking. Close enough to walk to the Emirates within half an hour and plenty of pubs on the walk there. Overall we didnt pay a lot at all £90 for two rooms for two nights and we got what we paid for,

Reviews.Title: “Flea Pit”
Reviews.Author: gaylord0
Reviews.Content: No greetings, demanded payment for room straight away and was given a key at the same time as he was playing games on the company computer. When i did find my room, it took me 10 minutes to put the key in the door and open it. Inside the room all the carpets was stained, the kiddies wardrobe door was hanging off, so there was no where to hang my clothes. THE EN SUIT!!...woke a joke that was, it was stinking, smelly and VERY dirty. When i had a shower all the water went on to the floor and the toilet lid would not stay up!!!!!!!! I think this place should be blown up and will never stay there again or recommend this place to anyone!!!

Reviews.Title: “COLD BEANS?!”
Reviews.Author: kmspence
Reviews.Content: I was very disappointed to find that this hotel was not only dirty and very run down, but there was no saving grace. The bathroom was dirty and I would not have used the shower if they paid me. The room was grubby, the windows were draughty and there was constant noise from the 'shack' outside. The breakfast was a sausage, a heavily salted egg and a teaspoon of cold beans. Me and my husband left very quickly and ended up at mcdonalds on the way home. DO NOT STAY HERE unless of course you want some sort of disease...

Reviews.Title: “The most terrible and unwelcoming hotel accommodation worldwide”
Reviews.Author: albyo
Reviews.Content: i booked for this hotel through travelstay.com, got there to find d most dilapitated and dirty building with a shed outside as a reception. No one was there for almost 10 mins before one very rude and uncanny guy tony emerged from across the road. The hotel was smelling, stinking, not worthy of occupation by human beings. They have no customer relationship. Of course i could not stay there and could not even get the booking agency to help. I had to check into another hotel and was charged for cancellation. I do not recommend it for anyone

Reviews.Title: “violent aggressive staff in crap hole - had to call police”
Reviews.Author: mione13
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say about the Shelton Hotel? The location is hard to find for starters. When we arrived the 24 hour reception (glorified shed next to most repulsive looking hotel I've ever seen) the man refused to check us in despite having all of the booking information printed to show him. He would not check his bookings and asserted that it had been cancelled (strangely I received no email or phone call cancelling my booking). The hotel was unlocked so a friend of mine ventured inside to find a manager. Upon which the receptionist locked her into the hotel and pushed another of my friends aside to do so. After we called the police (who were rather unhelpful) the thug that seems to pass as a receptionist in the Shelton's eyes removed the bookings list from his folder and rewrote it presumably to erase any evidence of our booking! Had to phone a cab as is a dangerous part of Islington and ended up paying almost £200 to get home. I would certainly not recommend this hotel to anyone, it was dreadful. The night porter/receptionist/psychopath was rude, aggressive and nasty. The hotel looked hideous and they were happy to leave 5 women stranded late on a Saturday in a rough area. We are considering our legal options at the moment.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely bad!”
Reviews.Author: foodphoto
Reviews.Content: Our room was very dirty. I've never seen more dirtier place to stay. The carpet was covered with ashes and cigarette, the bathroom was so dirty and never ever cleaned that I was afraid to touch something in it. The mattress on bed was covered with some plastic cover under bed-sheet so it rustling all night long. Break fast - terrible too. See photos and captions.

Reviews.Title: “Dreadful”
Reviews.Author: JaneBNorfolk_UK
Reviews.Content: A really nasty hotel. For the price I don't expect a lot; but cleanliness is not optional. The place was grubby, the bathroom basic - plenty of hot water is about the only positive thing I can say - the bedroom cramped. The tea cups were dirty. The curtains did not close, and the windows didn't fit, so the traffic noise was really bad. The advertised "free parking" is a couple of spaces on the pavement; very vulnerable to passing pedestrians. No local on-the-street parking available either. This was a thoroughly unpleasant one night stay which I won't be repeating.

Reviews.Title: “this place should be condemned..absolutely disgusting and dangerous”
Reviews.Author: stevo57
Reviews.Content: do not look at the pictures on the web site, its nothing like !! never been to such a [--] hole in all my life..it should be condemned and closed immediately so it doesnt cause psychological damage to anyone else. Environmental health should be called in now. They have a notice on the window that forbids you to enter with any cameras or recording equipment (i wonder why ?) Steer well clear...this place is worse than a halway house for tramps and vagrants in a third world country .

Reviews.Title: “crap hole..................................................”
Reviews.Author: missykala
Reviews.Content: What a cr hole, bird crap on the windows...it must have had the [--] there was sooo much, light had no shade and was hanging off the ceiling, the same goes for the wall plugs......tea and coffee making facilities....what a joke!!! two dirtys cups, two tea bags and s skanky kettle!!!! bed sheets full of hair and faded!!! none of the furniture matched...not a prob until you realise the door is missing from the wardrobe......walls are dirty and marks on the ceiling, shower tiny and walls were paper thin, her a man being sick in the middle of the night from upstairs....next door to a garage and thats what we had a view of.....went to breakfast once during our five day stay!! didnt want to risk it..dirty dirty hotel...staff unfriendly, didnt hardley speak english....no communication for anything...you had to leave your key whenever you went out....coming back to hotel there was no one there....we looked through the window and the man was asleep in the kitchen, had to knock on window to wake him up. had to pay on arrival. i asked if we can pay by card, they said ok, but it adds on an extra 10% or 15% they wasnt even sure!!!!!!!!!!!!!! they didnt ask for any I.D we could have been anyone, when you come back to the hotel we just sed room 15 and they had no problem given us the key...no security at all!! i wouldnt recoomend this hotel to my enemy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very very dirty hotel ,even if this place under hotel name .Avoid it.”
Reviews.Author: sammysahar
Reviews.Content: when I booked online i found the situation of the hotel is accepteble, when i arrived I shocked when I seeen the place how it is dirty and even less than hostel situation its like staple i would not recommended to anyone even its free charge , the room very dirty the beding &pillow full of hair and dirty sheet, the shawer I can discribe how is mizrable ,the toilet flash its not working ,shower floading ,no hot water , dirty cups with lip stik mark , tea bags is opened, and the ask for cash payment at 11:30PM to be paid to the reception man he wait on the street because no reception there. I recommened health inspecter to visit the place. owful contental breakfast. thats level of present not hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The most terrible hotel I've ever seen”
Reviews.Author: krissi8
Reviews.Content: The website looks really nice but you shouldn't believe a single word. 1) The 24 hour reception was closed, I had to wait outside the hotel and phone them 2) They wanted to give me the wrong room, I've booked a studio with kitchen included but they wanted to place me in a single room. She began to search for the reservation sheet and found it after 20 minutes!! 3) The lady wanted me to pay cash although the website said I can pay by credit card. We had a long discussion and she gave in. 4) When she showed me the studio it hadn't been cleaned yet. Everything was dirty, no fresh linen on the bed, the wardrobe was broken and there was even a dirty t-shirt on the ground. So I refused to stay. A strange thing is that I checked my credit card statement and found another debit of London Shelton Hotel. I'm sure I have never signed the bill containing this amount. Summary: It's shabby and dirty, staff is unfriendly, dodgy and unmotivated Nearly everything that's written on the webpage is a lie. So don't go there.

Reviews.Title: “What a nice hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kajsaSweden
Reviews.Content: We really liked this hotel.....arriving from Sweden the night before to a hotelin Piccadilly with was so awful you couldn´t sleep in the bed, we found this hotel and we liked it alot...we booked for 2 nights but we stayed one night extra.....If we are going back to London we will come back....you can be sure of that.Nice people working, nice rooms and a very good service!!!! 5 stars from Agneta, Malin, Kristin, Monica, Gustaf and Eric from Sweden.

Reviews.Title: “Awful, dirty, noisy, staff had a bad attitude, no Bar or Indian Restaurant”
Reviews.Author: Cape110
Reviews.Content: Arrived at 12.00 p.m., no 24 hour receptionist, only one room booked, when another room should have been booked (3 night stay), will be sorted out when receptionist arrives at 13.30 p.m. Room corridors dirty, carpet runners up the wall, rubbish and vacuum cleaner left in corridor. Room very basic, faded duvet cover, room not very clean, Bathroom not great, T.V. badly tuned, wires attached but everywhere. Eventually got hold of receptionist at 14.10 p.m. and she said she would sort it out, for our return from London at 18.30p.m., waited for 2nd room to be sort out, asked for compensation said no, 2nd bedroom, toilet seat dirty, no curtain in bathroom, view onto busy road. No card payment accepted only cash, put cash in top shirt pocket, no banking or accounting system. Asked for a drink, no bar facilities available. Continental breakfast, tea, coffee, toast, marmalade, 2 x susuages, fried egg (very oily), tried over stay for poached egg, didn't understand, scrabbled turned out as an omelete, no salt, pepper or tomatoe sauce and table not set. Bathroom was not cleaned or new towels given over 4 day stay. Difficulty in sleeping as noisy busy road. Hotel up for sale, advertisement should be removed from all internet accommodation sites, as nothing like write up or photographs. Bad impression of London for visitors from Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but OK for a 1 nite stay for the footie.”
Reviews.Author: ALIGWALES
Reviews.Content: When you enjoy a stay for one day - a football match and you like it cheap. it is ok to book. My partner and I stayed at the Hotel as it was easy access to the Emirates Stadium. Location was good - near Finsbury Park, and the Tube Station. Lots of bars and takeaways nearby. We stayed for 1 night. We were able to check in early - 11.3OAM. Check out time was 11.30am. The lock on the door was dogdy and difficult to lock. The bed was comfortable. The TV was large but did not work properly, unless you stood there and held the aerial in yourself. We had to pay in full before viewing the room. Breakfast not as described, (continental)we had sausage, egg, baked beans and 2 pieces of toast. The main light in the bedroom did not work. The shower facilties were not exactly wonderful- shower curtain was disgusting, which wrapped around you when showering. Staff were friendly. There were no parking facilities. Price was good, considering it was London. Would stay again for 1 or 2 nites.

Reviews.Title: “"How bad could it be?" - Famous last words!”
Reviews.Author: 116HCB
Reviews.Content: This 'hotel' is awful! My boyfriend and I decided to book a cheap hotel for the night, thinking 'how bad could it be?' - famous last words! I would not recommend this hotel to anbody, least of all children as we could smell drugs being smoked in multiple rooms. Once inside our room, we discovered just how dirty it was. The bed was covered in hair and the shower thick with black mould. The tiling within the shower was frankly dangerous as it was sticking out at very sharp angles. We decided to leave after approximately 5 minutes of entering the hotel. Please don't make the same mistake!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Stacey42
Reviews.Content: this was a lovely and friendly hotel...me and my kids went to stay for the weekend and enjoyed it very much with its cosy atmosphere..thankyou!

Reviews.Title: “Hell Hole”
Reviews.Author: Matty93
Reviews.Content: Turned up to be told the reservation had not been kept as the card had been declined but payment was supposed to be made on arrival according to the website I used?? I agree with all the comments about this place and find them all to be true, being dodgy and I did get the brothel feeling about the place too. It also seems to have DSS residents too. We were going to see Spurs and it is not that close to be honest. It is a treck from the nearby stations on the tube. It is a disgusting hotel with mildew in the showers and dirty carpets. Various windows including one in my mates room were smashed. We were locked in when we went leave in the morning and the only staff we could find were Spanish and eastern European and spoke no English. DO NOT STAY HERE!!!

HotelInfo.Name: London Shelton Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 60-62 Wightman Rd | Finsbury, London N4 1RU, England
